TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / click the continue button to start the experiment.
notext
The refrigerator is opened.
And all the required reagents for the experiment is taken and is arranged on the immunology lab table.
All the required reagents for the experiment is taken and is arranged on the immunology lab table.
notext
Close the refrigerator.
A butter paper is placed on the weigh balance (mg) and the balance is tared.
The purified Ig G antibody bottle is taken and the cap of the bottle is opened.
Some amount of purified Ig G antibody is added to the spatula.
Purified Ig G antibody is added to the butter paper placed in the weighing balance. 2mg of purified Ig G antibody is taken.
The spatula is placed back on the table.
The lid of the purified Ig G antibody bottle is closed.
The purified Ig G antibody bottle is placed back in the refrigerator.
notext
The Ig G antibody is taken from the balance.
The vial labeled as Ig G antibody is taken.
The purified Ig G antibody is added to the vial.
The IgG antibody vial is placed back on the rack.
A micropipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume of the micropipette is adjusted to 1000 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The lid of the sodium bicarbonate buffer bottle is opened and a 1000microlitre of solution is taken from the bottle.
The vial labeled as Ig G antibody is taken.
The sodium bicarbonate solution is added to the vial and it is mixed properly by pipetting it up and down.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The micropipette is placed back on the pipette stand.
notext
A forceps is taken from the lab table.
A small piece of dialysis tubing is taken from the Ethanol Storage Solution using the forceps.
The dialysis tubing is washed using the distilled water.
A clamp is taken from the bench top.
The clamp is inserted on the dialysis tubing at one side.
The dialysis tubing is placed back on the bench top.
A 1000microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as Ig G antibody is taken from the vial rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and pipette out 1000microlitre of Ig G antibody.
The vial is placed back in the vial rack.
The dialysis tubing is taken and it is filled using Ig G antibody.
The tip is discarded.
The air present in the dialysing tube is squeezed out and the clamp is inserted.
The dialysis tubing with Ig G antibody solution is placed on the PBS Buffer.
The magnetic Teflon is also placed in the PBS Buffer using a forceps.
The beaker containing PBS Buffer solution is taken from the bench top.
The beaker is placed on the magnetic stirrer which is placed inside the visicooler.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on and it is kept for 2 hours at 4 degree celsius.
After 2 hours, the magnetic stirrer is switched off and the beaker containing PBS buffer solution is taken out.
The beaker is placed back on the bench top and the dialysis tubing containing Ig G antibody solution is taken from the beaker.
The clamp from one side of the dialysis tubing is taken off.
The Ig G antibody solution from the dialysis tubing is pipetted out using a Pasteur pipette.
The vial labeled ad Dialysed Antibody is taken from the vial rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the dialysed Ig G antibody solution is added to it.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
A micro pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume is adjusted to 100microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted into it.
The cap of the sodium bicarbonate bottle is opened and 100 microlitre of solution is pipetted out.
The vial labeled ad Dialysed Antibody is taken from the vial rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the sodium bicarbonate buffer is added to it.The cap of the vial is closed.
The used tip is discarded to a beaker.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The cap of the vial is opened and add 100 microlitre of dialysed antibody is pipetted out.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The vial labeled as FITC-Antibody conjugate is taken from the vial rack.
The vial is opened and 100 microlitre of dialysed antibody is added to the vial.
notext
A micro pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume is adjusted to 20 microlitre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The cap of the sodium bicarbonate buffer bottle is opened and 20 microlitre of buffer is pipette out.
The vial labeled as FITC-Antibody conjugate is taken from the vial rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the sodium bicarbonate buffer is added to the vial.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The sodium bicarbonate buffer bottle is taken from the benchtop.
The bottle is placed back in the refrigerator.
notext
A butter paper is placed on the weigh balance (mg) and the balance is tared.
The FITC-Dye bottle is taken and its cap is opened.
Some amount of FITC-dye is taken from the bottle
The FITC-Dye is added to the butter paper placed on the weiging balance, 0.5mg of FITC -Dye is taken.
The spatula is placed back on the bench top.
The FITC-Dye bottle is taken from the bench top.
The bottle is placed back in the refrigerator.
The FITC–Dye is taken from the balance.
The vial labeled as FITC-Dye is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the FITC-Dye is added to the vial.
The vial with FITC Dye is placed back in the rack.
A micro pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume is adjusted to 50microlitre.
The cap of the anhydrous DMSO bottle is opened and 50 microlitre of DMSO is pipette out.The cap of the bottle is closed.
The vial labeled as FITC-Dye is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the anhydrous DMSO is added to the vial.
The solution is mixed properly using the pipette.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The volume is adjusted to 20microlitre.
The vial labeled as FITC-Dye is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and pipette out 20microlitre of FITC-Dye.
Discard the remaining Dye to a beaker.
The vial labeled as FITC-Antibody conjugate is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the 20microlitre of FITC-Dye is added to the vial.
The contents in the vial is mixed properly by vortexing it for 2-3 minutes.
The FITC-antibody conjugate is incubated at room temperature for 2 hours.
A butter paper is placed on the weigh balance (g) and the balance is tared.
The Sephadex G 100,Gel filtration resin bottle is taken and its cap is opened.
Some amount of Sephadex G 100 resin is taken from the bottle.
The Sephadex G 100 resin is added to the butter paper placed on the weighing balance.
0.04g Sephadex G 100 resin is taken.
The spatula is placed back on the bench top.
The Sephadex G 100 resin is taken from the balance.
The empty spin column is taken from the rack.
The cap of the spin column is opened and the Sephadex G 100 resin is added to the column.
The spin column is tapped so that the resin is settled at the bottom.
The column end stopper is taken from the rack.
The column end stopper is placed on the spin column.
The cap of the column is closed.
The spin column is placed back in the rack.
A micro pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume is adjusted to 800microlitre.
A new tip is inserted.
The cap of the 1X PBS Buffer with 2mM sodium azide bottle is opened and 800 microlitre of buffer is pipette out.
The spin column is taken from the rack.
The cap of the column is opened and add 800 microlitre of PBS buffer with 2mM Sodiumazide is added to the column.
The contents in the spin column is mixed properly by vortexing it for 5 seconds.
The column is then kept at room temperature for 30 minutes for hydration.
After 30 minutes,the spin column is taken from the rack and its cap is opened.
Its cap is opened.
The column end stopper is taken out from the column.
The column end stopper is placed back in the rack and the collection tube is taken.
The spin column is inserted into the collection tube.
The centrifuge is opened.
The collection tube with spin column is placed in the centrifuge.
Another spin column is taken and it is filled with water.
The spin column with water is inserted into the collection tube.
The centrifuge is then balanced using a collection tube containing water.
The centrifuge is set to 2 minutes at 1000xg.
After 2 minutes,the centrifuge is opened.
The collection tube with spin column is taken from the centrifuge.
The spin column is taken from the collection tube.
The solution in the collection tube is discarded.
The collection tube is placed back on the rack.
The spin column is placed back on the rack.
A micro pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
A new tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as FITC antibody conjugate is taken from the rack.
The entire solution from the vial is pipetted out.
The spin column is taken from the rack.
The cap of the spin column is opened and the Fitc-antibody conjugate is added to the column.
The collection tube is taken from the rack.
The spin column is inserted into the collection tube.
The centrifuge is opened.
The collection tube with spin column is placed in the centrifuge.
The centrifuge is balanced using another collection tube containing water.
The centrifuge is set to 5 minutes at 1000xg.
After 5 minutes, the centrifuge is opened.
The collection tube with spin column is taken from the centrifuge.
The spin column is taken from the collection tube. The purified protein sample is present in the collection tube.
The used spin column is discarded.
A 1000microlitre pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
A new tip is inserted.
The purified protein sample is pipetted out.
Discard the collection tube.
The vial labeled as purified sample is taken from the rack.
The purified protein sample from the pipette is added to the vial.
The purified protein sample from the pipette is added to the vial.
The tip is discarded.
A new tip is inserted.
The cap of the 1X PBS Buffer with 2mm sodium azide bottle is opened and the buffer is pipette out from the bottle.
The cuvette is taken from the cuvette holder.
The cuvette is filled using the PBS Buffer.
The lid of the cuvette slot in biophotometer is opened.
The wavelength is adjusted tor 280nm.
The enter button is then pressed.
The cuvette with the buffer is placed in the cuvette slot and the lid is closed.
The blank button is then pressed,The absorbance obtained is 0.00A.
The lid of the cuvette slot is opened and the cuvette is taken from the slot.
Discard the PBS buffer to a beaker.
The cuvette is placed back on the cuvette holder.
The used tip is then discarded.
A new tip is inserted.
The vial with purified sample is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the solution is pipetted out.
The vial is placed back on the rack.
The cuvette is taken from the cuvette holder.
The cuvette is filled using the purified protein sample.
The cuvette with purified sample is placed in the cuvette slot and the lid is closed.
The sample button is then pressed, The absorbance obtained is 0.20A.
The lid of the cuvette slot is opened and the cuvette is taken from the slot.
The purified sample from the cuvette is pipette out.
The cuvette is placed back in the cuvette holder.
The vial labeled as purified sample is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and it is filled using the purified sample.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The cap of the 1X PBS Buffer with 2mM sodium azide bottle is opened and the buffer is pipette out from the bottle.
The cuvette is taken from the cuvette holder.
The cuvette is filled using the PBS Buffer.
The wavelength is adjusted to 495nm.
The enter button is then pressed.
The cuvette with the buffer is placed in the cuvette slot and the lid is closed.
The blank button is then pressed,The absorbance obtained is 0.00A.
The lid of the cuvette slot is opened and the cuvette is taken from the slot.
Discard the PBS buffer to a beaker.
The used tip is then discarded.
A new tip is inserted.
The vial with purified sample is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the solution is pipetted out from the vial.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The cuvette is taken from the cuvette holder.
The cuvette is filled using the purified protein sample.
The cuvette with purified sample is placed on the cuvette slot and the lid is closed.
The sample button is then pressed,The absorbance obtained is 1.5A.
The vial with purified sample is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and pipette out the remaining purified sample.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
The light protected vial is taken from the rack.
The cap of the light protected vial is opened and the protein sample is added to it.
The vial is placed back in the rack.
A micropipette is taken from the pipette stand.
The volume is adjusted to 100 microlitre.
A new tip is inserted.
The cap of the 1X PBS Buffer with 2mM sodium azide bottle is opened and the buffer is pipette out from the bottle.
The light protected vial is taken from the rack.
The cap of the vial is opened and the buffer is added to it.
The refrigerator is opened and the vial is placed in the rack.
